intro: Thompsonella minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered thompsonella, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically range in color from pale pink to white. The plant grows as a herbaceous annual, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, while its flowering period occurs during the warmer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
